thread.title: NFL wrap: New Orleans hands Atlanta its first loss - Football
thread.title_full: NFL wrap: New Orleans hands Atlanta its first loss - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS |
title: NFL wrap: New Orleans hands Atlanta its first loss - Football
text:
Buy this photo Drew Brees passed for 312 yards Thursday night at New Orleans, Ben Watson racked up a career-high 127 yards receiving to go with a fourth-down touchdown catch and the Saints handed Atlanta its first loss, 31-21.
Desperate for a victory, the Saints (2-4) enjoyed big plays in all phases.
Michael Mauti, who grew up near New Orleans after his father, Rich, played for the Saints, blocked a punt and recovered it for a touchdown, delighting the Superdome crowd with a play reminiscent of Steve Gleason’s famous block against Atlanta in 2006.
Mark Ingram ran for two short touchdowns, and New Orleans’ defense recovered three fumbles — two inside its own 20.
Devonta Freeman rushed for 100 yards, including a 25-yard TD, for Atlanta (5-1). Matt Ryan passed for 295 yards and two touchdowns.
NFL SANCTIONS REFS: The NFL suspended side judge Rob Vernatchi for one game for not managing the clock properly in the fourth quarter of Pittsburgh’s game at San Diego on Monday night.
The NFL also has reassigned Greg Wilson, the back judge who missed an end-zone penalty in the final moments of Detroit’s loss at Seattle the previous Monday night. 
BRIEFS: The Raiders plan to put defensive end Justin Tuck on season-ending injured reserve because of a torn pectoral muscle, and the ex-Giant is expected to undergo surgery soon. … The Seahawks suspended Derrick Coleman after police arrested him in a hit-and-run investigation, but his lawyer insisted that if the fullback left the scene it was only because he was dazed. … Eagles coach Chip Kelly says he has not heard from USC athletic director Pat Haden or any college with a coaching opening.
